item.title: I can never remember which one is the slash and which one is the backslash.
item.description:
jordanlund 4 points 1 year ago[-]
Sad admission time...
I can never remember which one is the slash and which one is the backslash.
It's always "the one on the question mark" vs. "the one not on the question mark".
Or / vs. \ if you prefer.

zem 45 points 1 year ago[-]
\ is a backslash
/ is a reverse backslash

grantrules 27 points 1 year ago[-]
_ is a slash that fell over.

jmkogut 23 points 1 year ago[-]
| is a slash, vertically fixed.

[deleted] 27 points 1 year ago* [-]
( is a bent blash
^ is a crimped slash
% is a reverse backslash with two abominations
# is 4 slashes scissoring
~ is a drunk slash

gaoshan 24 points 1 year ago* [-]
! is a slash, vertically fixed and dressed in black with a white sock.
i same slash doing a headstand.
? same slash but very old.
. collapsable slash is collapsed.
`. emo slash is empty inside.
{*} goatse. Not a slash at all.

jmkogut 2 points 1 year ago[-]
The two abominations <3
AND THE 4 SLASHES SCISSORING <3

knome 8 points 1 year ago* [-]
T is a top aligned horizontal slash. You need the vertical one to hold it up.

jmkogut 0 points 1 year ago[-]
Oh my god. I never SAW THAT BEFORE

embretr 9 points 12 months ago* [-]
slash, seen from the pointy end
